class HdfsFileSystem extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
Not Public API

Loading and Configuration of HDFS FileSystems

HDFS filesystem wrapper used by HdfsFileSystemService to implement the KivaKit FileSystemService service provider interface. The of(FilePath) method here lazy-loads and configures an HdfsFileSystem object which gives access to the Hadoop FileSystem interface for the cluster specified in the given HDFS file path. Note that this means that multiple HDFS filesystems can be accessed at the same time and transparently. See FileSystemServiceLoader for details on how the KivaKit dynamically loads FileSystemService implementations.

Transparent Access to HDFS Files and Folders

Because HDFS filesystems are loaded based on FilePath parsing, the end-user only has to include the HDFS module in their project and they can then use HDFS file paths with File and Folder as they would use any other path.

For example, to access a file on cluster 'my-cluster', this module can be included and the following file object constructed. FileSystemServiceLoader will load the HdfsFileSystemService for the "hdfs" scheme and that service will then configure a Hadoop FileSystem instance (using this class) for the 'my-cluster' cluster. All of this occurs automatically when a file object is constructed like this: 

 new File("hdfs://my-cluster/test.txt");

Configuration of HDFS Clusters

HDFS clustered filesystems are configured with an hdfs-site.xml file and optionally a yarn-site.xml file. KivaKit locates these files by looking under the configuration folder specified by HdfsProxyServerSettings in the folder named for the cluster. For example: 

 [...]/configurations/my-cluster/hdfs-site.xml
 [...]/configurations/my-other-cluster/hdfs-site.xml
